Player History
Signed as a free agent by Montreal on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Earned first career win on 4/10/1986...
Had first career hit on 4/20/1986, off Danny Cox (STL)...
Hit first career homerun on 9/23/1986, off John Butcher (SD)...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,514,286 through salary arbitration...
Set a new season NL-Record for Strikeouts with 290 on 10/1/1988 ...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,700,000 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Montreal to Chicago on 5/11/1989 (Going to MON: CF Ken Griffey Jr., 1B Cecil Fielder, C Craig Biggio, C Rick Wilkins. Going to CHC: P Randy Johnson)...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,250,000 through salary arbitration...
7/12/1990: Signed a contract extension with Chicago, $5,540,000 per year, for 4 years.
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 8/1/1990, going 5-0, 0.47...
Set a new season NL-Record for Strikeouts with 303 on 9/28/1990 ...
Struck out 16 batters against Montreal on 9/28/1990...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 7/1/1991, going 5-1, 1.62...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
Injured on 8/1/1991 with a Spasms Back, out for 6-7 weeks...
